subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: just joined - where do i start?
msgSnippet: Thank you Moira, I m deeply appreciative of your offer.  I ve only just started reading Kingsley Read s QS manual, and i ll have to familiarize myself a bit
messageBody:
Thank you Moira, I'm deeply appreciative of your offer.  I've only just started reading Kingsley Read's QS manual, and i'll have to familiarize myself a bit more with the alphabet, before i can actually take you up on your offer.
And thanks Peter for your suggestion.  I'll take a look at it after i've reviewed the QS manual.
Bcs 

Moira O'Brien <mj@...> wrote:
After these good suggestions, my advice to you is to start writing as soon as possible.  This is by far the quickest way to learn.
 
If you would like to start corresponding then I suggest you join the Read_Alphabet_ Letters group.  In the meantime, if you would like to handwrite, scan and email to me I will be happy to correct and encourage :) as well as to give you some reading practice in return.
 
regards
 
Moira

 
On 22/01/2008, peter_r_guinness <malt99@optusnet. com.au> wrote:
--- In Read_Alphabet@ yahoogroups. com, "B.C. Siegl" <bcsiegl@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I just joined the group and am interested in learning QS. Where
do i
> start?
> Thanks in advance.
> BcS
>

You could try my Alice-in-Wonderland tutorials here:
http://members. optusnet. com.au/~malt99/ project_quickscr ipt_website/ inde
x.html
But please note that the tutorials use the General Australian accent
(eg: they drop the rhotic R so that it is quicker and easier for
Australians to learn).




--
Moira O'Brien

  And thanks Peter for your suggestion.  I'll take a look at it after i've reviewed the QS manual.
  Bcs

  If you would like to start corresponding then I suggest you join the Read_Alphabet_Letters group.  In the meantime, if you would like to handwrite, scan and email to me I will be happy to correct and encourage :) as well as to give you some reading practice in return.
